example.eg: The floor lamp has a large round base.
example.egtrans: 地灯有一个又大又圆的底座。

example.eg: The base of the house is solid concrete.
example.egtrans: 这栋房子的地基是结实的混凝土。

example.eg: The Bible provides the base for most Christian beliefs.
example.egtrans: 《圣经》构成了多数基督教信仰的基础。

dsense.name: base
dsense.guideword: (main ingredient) (事物的基本成分，比如汤底)

example.eg: The sauce has a tomato base.
example.egtrans: 这种调味酱以西红柿为主要成分。

example.eg: The United States Navy has a base in San Diego.
example.egtrans: 美国海军在圣地亚哥有个基地。

example.eg: We used the tree as the base, and measured everything from there.
example.egtrans: 我们以那棵树作为起点量测了一切。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 出发点, 起点, 基点

example.eg: They run a small chalet resort at the base of the mountain.
example.egtrans: 他们在山脚经营一家小小的木屋度假村。

example.eg: She based her conclusion on close examination of the evidence.
example.egtrans: 她的结论建立在对证据仔细检验的基础上。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 某事以…为根据, 某事以…为依据

example.eg: They will base the film on a short story written by Mark Twain.
example.egtrans: 他们会根据马克·吐温写的一个短篇故事来拍摄这部影片。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 让...以...为根据, 让...建立在...的基础上

example.eg: His base comments offended the women.
example.egtrans: 他低级的评论冒犯了那群女士。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 卑鄙的, 可鄙的, 低级的

example.eg: The runner passed second base and headed to third.
example.egtrans: 跑垒者通过了二垒，然后朝三垒进发。

example.eg: This liquid is a base, and not acidic.
example.egtrans: 这种液体是碱性的，不是酸性的。

example.eg: First you need to put on a base coat of paint.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 做基底的, 打底的, 形成基底的

example.eg: Tom's company based him in New York, but he travels all over the US.
example.egtrans: 汤姆的公司将他派驻到纽约，但他要去美国各地出差。

example.eg: The consultant was based in Miami but worked all over the country.
example.egtrans: 这位顾问被派驻在迈阿密，但要在全国各地到处跑。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 以…为工作基地, 被派驻在

example.eg: Fernando is based at the firm's São Paulo office.
example.egtrans: 费尔南多是以圣保罗的办事处为工作基地。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 驻扎在, 以…为工作基地

example.eg: His political ideas are based on his conservative beliefs.Ideally, your decision should be based upon sound reasoning.
example.egtrans: 他的政治理念是以其保守信念为基础。理想情况是您的决定应以合理推论为基础。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 建立在…上, 以…为基础

example.eg: The movie is based in Seattle, but sometimes episodes take place in Portland.
example.egtrans: 这部电影的故事发生在西雅图，但有些情节发生在波特兰。

dsense.name: be based on [sth], be based upon [sth]

example.eg: Many movies are based on true stories.  The play is based on the novel of the same name.
example.egtrans: 很多电影改编自真实故事。这个剧本是改编自同名小说。

example.eg: Some countries have laws based upon state religions.
Based on a true story.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 低空跳伞, 定点跳伞

example.eg: We'll meet at the base of the volcano and hike up together.
My daughter is no mountain climber, but she's trekking as far as the Everest base camp.
The batter got a base hit and the runner scored easily.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 低空跳伞, 定点跳伞
基准水平, 最低水平

example.eg: It was a cheap base metal but the gold plating made it look expensive.
The Allies moved their base of operations from England to the coast of Normandy.
The Hong Kong offices currently serve as the company's base of operations for global activities.
The pitcher gave a base on balls.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 四坏球后送上垒, 四球安全上垒

example.eg: The base pay for this job is low, but as you gain experience your pay will be increased.
The base plate is attached to the machine with four screws.
The base price is $20,000; if you want a stereo or air conditioning, that will be extra.
Banks use the base rate as their starting point when deciding on individual lending rates.
We're paid £55 a day as a base rate of pay.

dsense.name: base rate
dsense.guideword: UK (interest rate: Bank of England) (英国)

example.eg: The Bank of England set the base rate at 0.5 per cent.
Inexperienced workers entering this firm are paid the base salary.
The base wage for this job is low, but as you gain experience your pay will be increased.
These sales figures will be used as the baseline for the company's success in future years.
example.egtrans: 这些销售数据将作为公司未来几年成功的基准。

example.eg: The player serves from just behind the baseline.
example.egtrans: 球员在底线后发球。

example.eg: The machine monitors any deviation from the patient's baseline heart rate.
example.egtrans: 仪器会监测病人基准心率外的所有偏差值。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 基地贩卖部，基地杂货店

example.eg: The home improvement store expanded its customer base when it added a new garden center.
Police are compiling a database of crime locations.
The database contained four records with that name.
The batter hit a double.
Baseball is so dull that I fall asleep before anyone gets to first base.

dsense.name: first base
dsense.guideword: slang (kissing on a date) (俚语，指拉手、接吻)

example.eg: He thought the date was going well, but in the end he didn't even make it to first base.
A pitcher must throw the ball over home base for it to be declared a 'strike'.
In this game, home base is a large yellow square at the center of the board.
A pitcher must throw the ball over home plate for it to be declared a "strike.".
My aunt's a civilian worker on a military base.
The runner slid into the plate to score the winning run.
The batter was able to reach second base safely.

dsense.name: second base
dsense.guideword: US, slang, euphemism (fondling [sb]'s breasts) (亲密关系进展)

example.eg: How long did it take for you to reach second base with your girlfriend?
Our tax base has dwindled since the hurricane.

dsense.name: third base
dsense.guideword: (baseball: last of three bases that must be touched by runner) (棒球)

example.eg: The player made it to third base.
We'll touch base when you've finished the first task.
Touch base with me in a few weeks so I can see how the project's coming along.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 接触, 联系, 联络

example.eg: The crowd cheered when the batter hit a triple.
